pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:5.1: 56. The training rule on monasteries without monks
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:6.2: At that time a number of nuns who had spent the rainy-season residence in a village monastery went to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:6.4: “Venerables, where did you spend the rainy-season residence?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:6.5: We hope the instruction was effective?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:6.7: So how could the instruction be effective?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:7.2: “How can nuns spend the rainy season in a monastery without monks?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:7.3: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:7.6: How can nuns spend the rainy season in a monastery without monks?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:7.7: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:7.8: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:8.1: ‘If a nun spends the rainy season in a monastery without monks, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:10.2: she is not able to go to the instruction or to formal meetings of the community.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:10.3: If she thinks, “I will stay here for the rainy season,” and she prepares a dwelling, sets out drinking water and water for washing, and sweeps the precincts, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:10.4: At dawn, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:11.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:12.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
